physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Prostate was enlarged (3+), smooth; serum level of PSA was 10.7 ng per milliliter. Cystoscopy revealed no mucosal lesions in the bladder. Cytologic examination of a urine specimen revealed malignant cells consistent with transitional-cell carcinoma.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Two months before this evaluation, the patient had an episode of hematuria that resolved spontaneously. Sixteen months before, MRI revealed smooth narrowing of left distal ureter; ten months before, CT showed signs suggesting a tumor. Three months before, repeat CT revealed slight enlargement of the circumferential mass.
